title: In Lower-Tier Debate, Republicans Warn About Choice for President
title_page: In Lower-Tier Debate, Republicans Warn About Choice for President - The New York Times
text:
Remember us?
Four Republican candidates whom voters have strenuously ignored all year tried for a second — or third or fourth or fifth — look in a lower-tier debate on Tuesday, hoping the rise of national security as an issue might offer them a breakthrough.
With the threat of terrorism as fresh as the day’s shutdown of Los Angeles schools after a threat, the debate focused on the safety of Americans, and the candidates sounded ominous warnings about the serious choice of the next president.
“We have entered World War III,” Rick Santorum, a former senator from Pennsylvania, declared. “We have a leader who refuses to identify it and be truthful to the American people.”
